Prime Day 2025 is here from Tuesday, July 8 to Friday, July 11, and Lifehacker is sharing the best sales based on product reviews, comparisons, and price-tracking tools.

  • Subscribe to our shopping newsletter, Add to Cart, for the best sales sent to your inbox.

  • New to Prime Day? We have a primer on everything you need to know. Sales are accurate at the time of publication, but prices and inventory are always subject to change.

I didn't find out I was going to the Governor's Ball Music Festival last month until about 12 hours before I was supposed to arrive there. Frantically, I set to work planning out my outfit and what I'd pack before realizing I didn't have a portable phone charger handy. I ran over to the deli and asked them to give me whatever they had, which turned out to be a tiny, white box that came with pre-attached Lightning and USB-C cables, plus a magnetic charging pad that could accommodate another phone or an Apple Watch.

In the month since that all went down, I've carried the little guy everywhere, and used it every single day—and there's one just like it for sale on Amazon during Prime Day. I love it because all the cords you need are built-in, so you don't have to remember a cable—you can just change on the go

Why you need this Rorry portable charger

This Rorry portable charger is usually $33, but it's marked down to $26 right now. Available in a rainbow of colors and in the compact size of 4.33 x 2.83 x 0.83 inches, here's what it offers:

What do you think so far?

  • A USB-C charger

  • A Lightning charger

  • A magnetic charger for phones or Apple Watches

  • Enough power to fully charge an iPhone 15 once or an Apple Watch 10 times

  • A keychain attachment

This beats my bodega special, which is bigger, plain white, and missing the useful keychain. I'll be buying as an upgrade as soon as I finish writing this article.

Looking for something else? Retailers like Walmart, Best Buy, and Home Depot have Prime Day competition sales that are especially useful if you don’t have Amazon Prime.

  • Walmart’s Prime Day competition sale begins at midnight on July 8 and will include deals up to 50% off. It’s an especially good option if you have Walmart+. 

  • Best Buy’s Prime Day competition sale, “Black Friday in July,” runs through Sunday, July 13 and has some of the best tech sales online. It’s an especially good option if you’re a My Best Buy “Plus” or “Total” member.

  • Home Depot extended its 4th of July sale through at least July 9, competing with some amazing deals of its own. It’s an especially good option if you’re looking for power tools, appliances, or outdoor equipment.
